DataElement.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity documenting the weight of a malignant neoplasm tissue segment which is suitable for proteomic and genomic analysis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis._The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.

Concepts.definition: Sufficient total material from each patient, divided to yield a minimum of one aliquot, preferably divided into three to five aliquots, of specified cancer tissue suitable for processing for proteomic and genomic analysis.

Property.preferredDefinition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

Concepts.definition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/26/21 jk Released per SME (NGM) review and approval. 9/23/20 jk created CPTAC Solid tumor procurement CRF.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity._A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.
A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
